question: Q1 To begin, we have some questions about women. To what extent do you agree or disagree ...?  Q1a A working mother can establish just as warm and secure a relationship with her children as a mother who does not work.
Q1 To begin, we have some questions about women. To what extent do you agree or disagree ...?  Q1b A preschool child is likely to suffer if his or her mother works.
Q1 To begin, we have some questions about women. To what extent do you agree or disagree ...?  Q1c All in all, family life suffers when the woman has a full-time job.
Q1 To begin, we have some questions about women. To what extent do you agree or disagree ...?  Q1d A job is all right, but what most women really want is a home and children.
Q1 To begin, we have some questions about women. To what extent do you agree or disagree ...?  Q1e Being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay.
Q2 And to what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q2a Both the man and woman should contribute to the household income
Q2 And to what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q2b A man's job is to earn money; a woman's job is to look after the home and family.
Q3 Do you think that women should work outside the home full-time, part-time or not at all under the following circumstances?  Q3a When there is a child under school age.
Q3 Do you think that women should work outside the home full-time, part-time or not at all under the following circumstances?  Q3b After the youngest child starts school.
Q4 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q4a Married people are generally happier than unmarried people.
Q4 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q4b People who want children ought to get married.
Q4 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q4c It is all right for a couple to live together without intending to get married.
Q4 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q4d Divorce is usually the best solution when a couple can't seem to work out their marriage problems.
Q5 Children grow up in different kinds of families. To what extent do you agree or disagree to the following statements?  Q5a One parent can bring up a child as well as two parents together.

Q5 Children grow up in different kinds of families. To what extent do you agree or disagree to the following statements?  Q5b A same sex female couple can bring up a child as well as a male-female couple.

Q5 Children grow up in different kinds of families. To what extent do you agree or disagree to the following statements?  Q5c A same sex male couple can bring up a child as well as a male-female couple.
Q7 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q7a Watching children grow up is life's greatest joy.
Q7 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q7b Having children interferes too much with the freedom of parents.
Q7 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q7c Children are a financial burden on their parents.
Q7 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q7d Having children restricts the employment and career chances of one or both parents.
Q7 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q7e Having children increases people's social standing in society.
Q7 To what extent do you agree or disagree...?  Q7f Adult children are an important source of help for elderly parents.
Q9 IF THERE SHOULD BE PAID LEAVE And who should pay for this leave?

answer.3: Both the government and the employer

question: Q10 IF THERE SHOULD BE PAID LEAVE Still thinking about the same couple, if both are in a similar work situation and are eligible for paid leave, how should this paid leave period be divided between the mother and the father?
Q11a Consider a family with a child under school age. What, in your opinion, is the best way for them to organize their family and work life?
Q11b And, in your opinion, which of these options would be the least desirable?
Q12 People have different views on childcare for children under school age. Who do you think should primarily provide childcare?
Q13 Who do you think should primarily cover the costs of childcare for children under school age?

Q14 Thinking about elderly people who need some help in their everyday lives, such as help with grocery shopping, cleaning the house, doing the laundry etc. Who do you think should primarily provide this help?
Q15 And who do you think should primarily cover the costs of this help to these elderly people?

answer.1: The elderly people themselves/ their family

question: Q18 How do you and your spouse/ partner organize the income that one or both of you receive? Please choose the option that comes closest.

answer.1: I manage all and give partner his share
answer.2: Partner manages all and gives me my share
answer.3: We pool all money, each take out
answer.4: We pool some money, rest separate
answer.5: We each keep own money separate

TW.6: My son or my daughter-in-law manages the money

question: Q19 In your household who does the following things ...?  Q19a Does the laundry?

answer.6: Is done by a third person

question: Q19 In your household who does the following things ...?  Q19b Makes small repairs around the house?

answer.6: Is done by a third person

question: Q19 In your household who does the following things ...?  Q19c Cares for sick family members?

answer.6: Is done by a third person

question: Q19 In your household who does the following things ...?  Q19d Shops for groceries?

answer.6: Is done by a third person

question: Q19 In your household who does the following things ...?  Q19e Does the household cleaning?

answer.6: Is done by a third person

question: Q19 In your household who does the following things ...?  Q19f Prepares the meals?

answer.6: Is done by a third person

question: Q20 Which of the following best applies to the sharing of household work between you and your spouse/ partner?

answer.1: I do much more than my fair share
answer.2: I do a bit more than my fair share
answer.3: I do roughly my fair share
answer.4: I do a bit less than my fair share
answer.5: I do much less than my fair share

question: Q21 When you and your spouse/ partner make decisions about choosing shared weekend activities, who has the final say?
Q22 Considering all sources of income, between you and your spouse/ partner, who has the higher income?

answer.1: My spouse/ partner has no income
answer.2: I have a much higher income
answer.4: We have about the same income
answer.5: My spouse/ partner has a higher income
answer.6: My spouse/ partner has a much higher income

question: Q23 How often has each of the following happened to you during the past three months?  Q23a I have come home from work too tired to do the chores which need to be done.

answer.0: Doesn't apply, no job, no family responsibilities

question: Q23 How often has each of the following happened to you during the past three months?  Q23b It has been difficult for me to fulfil my family responsibilities because of the amount of time I spent on my job.

answer.0: Doesn't apply, no job, no family responsibilities

question: Q23 How often has each of the following happened to you during the past three months?  Q23c I have arrived at work too tired to function well because of the household work I had done.

answer.0: Doesn't apply, no job, no family responsibilities

question: Q23 How often has each of the following happened to you during the past three months?  Q23d I have found it difficult to concentrate at work because of my family responsibilities.

answer.0: Doesn't apply, no job, no family responsibilities
